cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 375 miles ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving quickly west toward south-central Texas; forecast to cross the coast Tuesday and continue inland into northern Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Texas coast between Port Mansfield and Corpus Christi

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Texas shoreline from the Mexico border northward to Sargent, including Baffin, Corpus Christi and Matagorda Bays
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts below tropical-storm force (generally <35 mph) possible Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rise south of Galveston; surge at Houston Ship Channel expected <1 ft
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased rip currents along upper Texas coast
